docs.title: Welcome to Notifs Documentation
docs.text:
Notifs is a Python module designed to make terminal notifications easy and customizable.

Explore the following sections to get started:

  • Installation

  • Usage

  • API Reference

docs.title: API Reference
docs.text: Notifs provides a simple API to display notifications with various styles and colors.

docs.title: notif
docs.text:
Display a customizable notification.

Arguments: - text (str): The text message to display. - symbol (str, optional): The symbol to display at the beginning of the message. Defaults to '!'. - color (str, optional): The color of the message. Supported colors: red, green, yellow, blue, magenta, cyan, white. Defaults to 'yellow'. - style (str, optional): The style of the notification. Options are 'full', 'partial', 'symbol'. Defaults to 'symbol'.

Example:

from notifs import notif

notif("Hello, World!", symbol='*', color='green', style='full')

This will display the message "Hello, World!" with a green asterisk and green text.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
Install Notifs using pip:

pip install notifs

Ensure you are using the correct Python environment where you want to install the Notifs module.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: After installing Notifs, you can use it to display different types of notifications in the terminal.

docs.title: Basic Notification
docs.text:
import notifs

# Default notification
notifs.notif("This is a default notification.")

docs.title: Customized Notifications
docs.text:
You can customize the symbol, color, and style of the notification.

# Custom symbol and color
notifs.notif("Custom notification", symbol='*', color='blue')

For more examples, check out the API Reference.
